headline: I think I figured out why the pifinder recommends you use a beefy raspberry pi 3.

markdown.content: The code's open source, so I looked through it. Turns out every time it tries to draw a map of the sky, it loops through every single star in the sky down to magnitude 7.5. Every frame. Sigh
At least it's open source, so I can probably add some caching and massively speed it up.
